1.brief: great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

2.brief: delight, concretely (the cause or object) or abstractly (the feeling)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, the flank; but used only figuratively, the rear or recess
properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

3.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
defence, high fort (tower), refuge, Misgab, a place in Moab

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to fix upon (by agreement or appointment); by implication, to meet (at a stated time), to summon (to trial), to direct (in a certain quarter or position), to engage (for marriage)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

5.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
properly, to start up suddenly, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, to fear

6.brief: to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage

7.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind)
Tarshish, a place on the Mediterranean, hence, the ephithet of a merchant vessel (as if for or from that port); also the name of a Persian and of an Israelite

8.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

9.brief: to compare; by implication, to resemble, liken, consider

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple

10.brief: an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

11.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style

12.brief: to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to strike with more or less violence (beat, fell, corrode); by implication (of attack) to knock together, i.e. surround or circulate
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers

13.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
hinder; generally, late or last; specifically (as facing the east) western

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
'To die for the son', probably the title of a popular song

the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
